intro: Gnidia thesioides var. condensata, commonly known as the dense-flowered gnidia, is a shrub native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its dense clusters of small, white to pale yellow flowers that bloom in spring. Its leaves are simple, opposite, and often have a slightly hairy texture. It is often grown as an ornamental plant due to its attractive floral display and compact growth habit.
